channel.title: Installing Kubuntu
channel.description: Well, I'm going to install Kubuntu as a dual boot tommorow, but I have a question. In Ron's tutorial he says that it's better to use a different partition manager then the one you use when installing Kubuntu from the live-cd. But is this true, in the official tutorial it just uses the Kubuntu one. There is some important stuff on my computer, but I backed it up so thats no problem. But reinstalling Vista when it goes wrong is a pain in the ass, so I'd rather prevent that.

item.title: Installing Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’ve already installed it, but it still sucks

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Well, if you feel uncomfortable installing ubuntu or any sort of linux, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,257417.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Last time I changed a partition, it was on my desktop. That thing is slow as fuck compared to my laptop, and by now it should at least be at 5-10%.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 27, 2008, 02:08:57 PM[/size][hr]It’s installing now, but it is stuck at 82% for a while now. It says looking up mirror servers. What’s wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:8, topic:193110”]Did you go back to windows, or did you use a different distro?

Anyways, it’s still stuck at 0%. What’s wrong with this thing?[/quote]
your computer may be slow, mine is fairly fast and it took 3 hours for kubuntu

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Make sure your wireless card is compatible with kubuntu, i used wubi, it is very nice, but i couldnt connect to the internet so i had to leave it

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Oh well, I’m currently installing it on my laptop. I’m writing this with my desktop pc. One thing that I noticed was that I couldn’t connect to the internet. But I hope I can solve that when Kubuntu is installed.

Edit: How long should it take the Kubuntu installer to partition my HDD? It’s stuck at 0% for a few minutes now…

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Not to my knowledge, I believe it helps considerably for people without cd/dvd drives, or people who may not feel safe installing Ubuntu. It also has a simple boot menu, allowing you to choose Windows, or your favorite flavor of *ubuntu.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Wubi installs ubuntu as an ‘application’ in windows, but does that matter anything for the performance of ubuntu/kubuntu?

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Just use Wubi, it’s practically failsafe. You can use KDE as the desktop environment on install. It also has a boot menu.

Read full topic

item.title: Installing Kubuntu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Kubuntu’s installer should be fine. It uses qtparted, whereas gparted is nicer and more mature (you might find it easier to use) they both use the same backend (parted)

Read full topic
